bill_title: Proposing and submitting to the electors at the next general election an amendment to Article III of the Constitution of the State of South Dakota, relating to the authority of a special interim legislative committee to approve the transfer of appropriated  funds.

bill_versions.bill_text: A JOINT RESOLUTION, Proposing and submitting to the electors at the next general election an amendment to Article III of the Constitution of the State of South Dakota, relating to the authority of a special interim legislative committee to approve the transfer of appropriated funds. BE IT RESOLVED BY THE HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA, THE SENATE CONCURRING THEREIN: Section 1. That at the next general election held in the state, the following amendment to Article III of the Constitution of the State of South Dakota, as set forth in section 2 of this Joint Resolution, which is hereby agreed to, shall be submitted to the electors of the state for approval. Section 2. That Article III of the Constitution of the State of South Dakota be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: § 33. The Legislature may, by law, empower a committee comprised of members of both houses of the Legislature, acting during recesses or between sessions, to approve transfers of appropriated funds during that fiscal year. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.015 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

A JOINT RESOLUTION, Proposing and submitting to the electors at the next general election an amendment to Article III of the Constitution of the State of South Dakota, relating to the authority of a special interim legislative committee to approve the transfer of appropriated funds. BE IT RESOLVED BY THE HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA, THE SENATE CONCURRING THEREIN: Section 1. That at the next general election held in the state, the following amendment to Article III of the Constitution of the State of South Dakota, as set forth in section 2 of this Joint Resolution, which is hereby agreed to, shall be submitted to the electors of the state for approval. Section 2. That Article III of the Constitution of the State of South Dakota be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: § 33. The Legislature may, by law, empower a committee comprised of members of both houses of the Legislature, acting during recesses or between sessions, to approve or disapprove transfers of appropriated funds during that fiscal year. BILL HISTORY 1/14/97 First read in House and referred to State Affairs. H.J. 33 1/22/97 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/22/97 State Affairs Do Pass, Passed, AYES 11, NAYS 1. 1/23/97 House of Representatives Do Pass, Passed, AYES 64, NAYS 4. H.J. 103 1/24/97 First read in Senate and referred to State Affairs. S.J. 165 1/29/97 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/29/97 State Affairs Do Pass, Passed, AYES 8, NAYS 0. S.J. 205 1/30/97 Motion to Amend. S.J. 253 1/30/97 Senate Do Pass, Passed, AYES 20, NAYS 15. S.J. 254 1/30/97 Intent to reconsider. S.J. 255 1/31/97 Deferred to another day. S.J. 260 2/3/97 Referred to State Affairs. S.J. 298 2/19/97 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/19/97 State Affairs Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 7, NAYS 1. S.J. 512
